July 7, 2025 Is this the beginning of the end for Opus Dei?
The second-in-command of Opus Dei worldwide has just been charged with human trafficking.
Meanwhile, the Trump regime guts the Gospel with ICE expansion, cruelty to migrants, and climate denial that leaves children vulnerable to catastrophe.
This isn’t chaos. It’s a coordinated assault on democracy, compassion, and truth….engineered by far-right Catholic power players, hidden in plain sight.
In this episode of Not Today, Satan, I break down:• The criminal charges against Opus Dei’s global #2• The “One Big Beautiful Bill” that weaponizes poverty• The devastating floods in Texas—and the systems meant to warn us that are being defunded
This is a moral reckoning: for the Church, for America, for all of us.
🙏 Hold the victims in your prayers. And let your prayers become action.

episodes.title: They want you dulled, hopeless, obedient… RESIST the MAGA Death Cult
episodes.description:
Mike Johnson thinks he’s Moses…but he and the other Project 2025 goons aren’t parting the seas. They’re secretly cheering on the floods.

Precious little girls swept away in raging waters, torn from the arms of their mothers. Families crushed by climate disasters, starvation, and disease…all worsened by cuts to public services meant to protect us. This isn’t neglect. It’s design.

Project 2025 is a death cult.
Their goal is to break your empathy. To leave you numb, hopeless, obedient; to “the will of God” as they define it.

This is all on you, MAGA.
You elected people who worship and encourage death.
Who profit from it. Who spiritualize it. Who demand it.

So if you do one thing today:
Refuse to let your empathy dull.
Feed birds. Step into the sun. Breathe.
Hold the softness of this world close - because that’s your rebellion. Much more is required of us, but start by refusing to let your empathy dull.  

#Project2025 #MikeJohnsonIsNotMoses #DeathCult

episodes.title: Opus Dei Archbishop SHOCKER - Not Today Satan: June 11, 2025
episodes.description:
June 11, 2025 - Not Today, Satan!  In today’s broadcast, we dive into three unfolding stories that lay bare the growing influence of far-right Catholic extremism in American politics. We begin with Senator Chuck Grassley’s effort to spin a legitimate FBI investigation into a narrative of false persecution. Then, we turn to a surprising act of integrity from Archbishop José Gomez, who breaks ranks with the MAGA-aligned hierarchy. And finally, we look ahead to this Saturday’s extraordinary contrast: Trump’s militarized birthday parade in D.C. versus Pope Leo XIV’s message of peace, livestreamed from Rome to a crowd in his hometown of Chicago.

This isn’t just about policy differences. It’s a full-scale confrontation between authoritarian ambition and democratic conscience. Between spiritual manipulation and moral clarity.

Follow me on all my social media channels.  Link to them all here:  https://linktr.ee/TheFlyingKitchen

✝️ What do you do each day to stay grounded in peace, justice, and clarity? Tell me in the comments.

Join me soon for this live long-form content.  Viewer participation via thoughtful comments are encouraged. 

Today we will examine Pope Leo's first 10 days in the papacy, what he's said about the world, and if he will stand with the peoples of the world against hate, greed and authoritarian regimes. 

We will also examine the following topics: 

Nuances surrounding the balance of power in the world today - white supremacy, erasure, genocide. 

Pope Leo’s statements on marriage, sexuality and reproductive rights.

Historical precedents of stuff pope’s have said. 

Why the crux of all of this is Vatican II

And attempt to answer the questions: 

Should we remain hopeful that Pope Leo will move the needle towards human rights?

Can we make an assessment right now as to the intent of the right side of SCOTUS regarding a theocracy? 

Is the evolution of The Catholic Church in response to the voice and expectations of the people?  Or is the voice and expectation of the people in response to the evolution of the Catholic Church?

Is Project 2025 Heretical?

episodes.title: Project 2025: Theocracy in Disguise #project2025 #LeonardLeo#CommonGoodConstitutionalism
Pope Leo: What they don't want you to know!
episodes.description:
While some speculate due to a 2019 Mass he presided over honoring Opus Dei’s founder, the context tells a different story. At the time, Leo was the bishop of Chiclayo, Peru—a region with significant Opus Dei influence. Participating in local religious events was part of his episcopal duties, not an endorsement.

Moreover, Pope Leo has a history of confronting abuse within the Church. He played a pivotal role in addressing misconduct in the Sodalitium Christianae Vitae, meeting with survivors and supporting reforms.

The narrative suggesting his allegiance to Opus Dei seems to stem from critics like Austin Ruse, an Opus Dei member, who circulated the photo to cast doubt. However, this appears more as an attempt to undermine than evidence of secret sympathies.

For a deeper dive into this topic, check out Gareth Gore’s insightful article on his substack entitled “The New Pope and Opus Dei”. 
https://open.substack.com/pub/garethgore/p/the-new-pope-and-opus-dei?r=u71n9&utm_medium=ios

episodes.title: REMEMBER HIS NAME - LEONARD LEO. Book club update!! #leonardleo #opus #opusdei
The Dark Money, Secrecy and Influence of Leonard Leo with Tom Carter
episodes.description:
In this episode, Shannon Vavich and Tom Carter delve into the controversial influence of Leonard Leo and Opus Dei within the American judiciary and political landscape. They discuss Leo's role in shaping the Supreme Court, the intertwining of far-right Catholicism with evangelical movements, and the implications for democracy and religious freedom. The conversation highlights the contradictions in Leo's actions, the web of influence he has created, and the challenges facing mainstream Catholicism in America today. In this conversation, Shannon Vavich and Tom Carter delve into the controversial activities of the Red Hat group, the influence of Leonard Leo in shaping a theocratic agenda in America, and the ongoing efforts to build community against fascism. They discuss the implications of a potential theocratic America, the role of humor and hope in activism, and the importance of awareness and education in combating extremist ideologies. #leonardleo #opusdei #scotus 

The Leo-influenced website hoping to influence the Post-Francis Papacy:
https://collegeofcardinalsreport.com/

https://linktr.ee/TheFlyingKitchen

TAKEAWAYS:
- Shannon Vavich discusses her encounter with Opus Dei 25 years ago.
-Tom Carter shares his experience working with Leonard Leo.
-Leonard Leo is known for his significant influence on the judiciary.
-The Federalist Society plays a crucial role in conservative judicial appointments.
-Contradictions exist in Leonard Leo's actions regarding religious freedom.
-The relationship between evangelicals and Catholics has evolved over time.
-Leonard Leo's network is extensive and influential in politics.
-Far-right Catholicism is on the rise in America.
-The future of Catholicism in America is uncertain with many leaving the church.
-The motivations behind conversions to Catholicism are questioned. The Red Hat Society has been linked to creating opposition files on potential popes.
-Leonard Leo's influence is pervasive in shaping the current political landscape.
-There is a push among certain factions for a theocratic America.
-Community building is essential in resisting fascist ideologies.
-Humor and hope are powerful tools in activism.
-The far-right is becoming more vocal and open about their intentions.
-Awareness and education are crucial in combating extremist ideologies.
-The concept of 'Church Militant' reflects a dangerous blend of religion and politics.
-The importance of grassroots movements in creating change.
-The conversation highlights the need for unity among those opposing fascism.

episodes.title: Why Do MAGA Catholics HATE Pope Francis So Much???
episodes.description:
In this episode, Shannon Vavich engages with Mark Shea to explore the complex relationship between MAGA Catholics and Pope Francis. They discuss the historical context of the pro-life movement, the concept of heresy within Catholicism, and the implications of nationalism and tribalism in faith. The conversation delves into how political agendas have shaped Catholic beliefs and practices, particularly regarding abortion and social justice. Shea emphasizes the need for a holistic understanding of Catholic teaching that transcends partisan divides, advocating for a faith that prioritizes the dignity of all human life. In this conversation, Shannon Vavich and Mark Shea explore the complexities of contemporary Christianity, particularly in relation to the MAGA movement, the pro-life stance, and the broader implications of legalism and cruelty in society. They discuss the absurdity of imposing law as a means of salvation, the mystery of evil, and the dangers of a culture that promotes scarcity and fear. The dialogue emphasizes the importance of empathy, the need to address victims of cruelty, and the role of laypeople in evangelism. Ultimately, they highlight the revolutionary force of Christianity and the hope that persists amidst historical challenges, advocating for a return to the core teachings of the Gospel and Catholic social teaching.

Shannon's Socials can be found here:
https://linktr.ee/TheFlyingKitchen

Find Mark on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/share/12KTEEYCRWR/?mibextid=wwXIfr

Takeaways
MAGA Catholics harbor significant discontent towards Pope Francis due to his inclusive approach to social issues.
The pro-life movement has evolved into a heretical interpretation of Catholic teaching, focusing narrowly on abortion.
Heresy is defined as a monomania, where one aspect of faith is emphasized to the exclusion of others.
Family and nation are often idolized in conservative Catholic circles, overshadowing the kingdom of God.
Economic policies significantly impact abortion rates, challenging the narrative that solely focuses on legal restrictions.
Media plays a crucial role in shaping Catholic beliefs, often simplifying complex teachings into sound bites.
The Church's stance on war and torture has been compromised by political agendas, particularly among conservative Catholics.
The election of Pope Francis marked a shift towards a more inclusive and socially aware Catholicism, which has faced backlash.
Racial and national identities have become intertwined with religious beliefs, complicating the Church's universal message.
The Church's teachings are intended for all humanity, not just specific tribes or nations. Imposing law as a means of salvation is absurd.
Legalism leads to failure in understanding salvation.
Cruelty and judgment are prevalent in contemporary Christianity.
Evil is a mystery that often defies logic.
Grave evil disguises itself as courage.
Empathy is increasingly labeled as a sin.
A culture of scarcity breeds fear and hostility.
The Great Replacement Theory fuels racism and xenophobia.
The pro-life movement has strayed into moral heresy.
Hope exists in the revolutionary force of Christianity.

episodes.title: Fascism in The Church - Our Experiences Watching Opus Dei and MAGA Infiltrate and Divide
episodes.description:
First Episode of "opus deiNOT GONNA GET AWAY WITH IT" - Exposing the hidden powers behind Project 2025.  Episode 1: From Catholicism to Deconstruction: Michele's Story

In this episode, Shannon Vavich and Michele Quigley delve into the complexities of Project 2025, exploring its implications on democracy and the influence of far-right Catholic ideologies. Michele shares her personal journey from a Methodist upbringing to deep involvement in Catholicism, discussing the impact of strict teachings on family life, contraception, and the challenges faced when questioning authority within the church. The conversation also touches on the political polarization within religious communities and the fallout experienced after leaving the church, highlighting the intersection of faith and fascism in contemporary society. In this conversation, Michele Quigley and Shannon Vavich explore the complexities of motherhood, societal expectations, and the value of women beyond childbearing. They discuss the impact of patriarchy, the importance of religious freedom, and the role of artistic expression in personal healing. The dialogue emphasizes the need for community support, resilience in the face of judgment, and the power of individuality. Through their shared experiences, they highlight the significance of finding joy and beauty in everyday life, encouraging listeners to embrace their unique paths and foster connections with like-minded individuals.
